intro: Grewia furfuracea, commonly known as the roughleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height. The plant features simple, ovate leaves with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Its fruit is a dry, capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Grewia furfuracea is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
